Tabs

The following are general guidelines that are meant to help you create a clean, seamless, and unified user experience for our learners. Use your judgment when building tabs

  1. Use tabs sparingly and with a bit of caution. 
  2. Tab titles in the header row should be no longer than 2-3 short words. Excessively long tab titles expand the tabs in the header row, making for a less visually appealing experience.
  3. Limit the number of tabs in one tab set to no more than XXX. If more tabs are necessary to present content in this format, consider an alternative formatting option.
